response: narrative=Eric Haynes was last seen near the bridge on Tayside Street, Carnoustie, DD7 6AX, possibly involved in a boating incident with colleague Leslie Morris. There were speculations about his connection to a cult, possibly witnessing a crime.

narrative=Eric Haynes, a 9-year-old foster child, was last seen at a military base in Dundee. There were concerns that Eric, possibly living off-grid, had been influenced by a nearby group suspected of cult activities. Known to roam and explore, Eric had been spotted entering an elevator within the base by a colleague, Conor Lowe, who later reported seeing him talking to unidentified individuals linked to suspicious activities. Furthermore, Eric might have witnessed a crime that could have prompted his disappearance. He was eventually traced by police on New Road, Forfar, unharmed but carrying numerous pamphlets that hinted at a connection to the cult.

narrative=Eric Haynes, a 10-year-old boy originally from Newport and currently in a foster situation, was reported missing from his home at 22 Marine Parade Walk, Dundee. Concern grew when Eric failed to return home after spending the afternoon with Tom Fletcher, a friend, at the skate park. Eyewitnesses later reported seeing Eric near a nearby construction site, leading to speculation about whether he might have wandered off to a travel-related location like the summer camp nearby. There were also unconfirmed rumors suggesting Eric had been influenced by a group with cult-like tendencies and might have attempted to live off-grid on a disused military base at 6 Lownie Road, Forfar. However, he was eventually traced by police at 23 City Road, Dundee, safe and unharmed.

narrative=Eric Haynes went missing from his foster father's car in a parking lot on Roseberry Street, Dundee. Last seen playing with a friend near a military base, search efforts focused on travel-related spots in the area. He was found safe after being traced by police to another location.

narrative=Eric Haynes was last seen near a military base close to his home at 22 Marine Parade Walk, Dundee. Before his disappearance, Eric had been participating in a volunteer organization's event. His friend, Leanne Carey, recalled a conversation where Eric mentioned observing strange activities nearby. Authorities considered the possibility of Eric witnessing a crime connected to a supposed cult operating in the area. Days before, he had expressed a fascination with boats, possibly hinting at a boating incident. Investigators focused on linking these elements as they searched for Eric. He was later found in Dundee, and police brought him safely home.

narrative=Eric Haynes was reported missing after failing to return home from spending time at Discovery Quay, Dundee. It was believed he might have ventured towards the construction site at 150 Strathmartine Road, Dundee, after mentioning plans to meet his friend, Leanne Carter. Concerns grew as Eric had shown an interest in living off-grid, and there were unverified reports of him possibly being involved in a local cult he encountered. Speculations arose that Eric may have witnessed a crime related to travel scams in the area. Thankfully, he was found safe at a residence on Auldbar Road, Forfar, ending the worrying ordeal.

narrative=Eric Haynes, an 11-year-old boy in foster care, was reported missing after failing to return home from a trip to a local construction site on New Road, Forfar, DD8 2AE. His foster parents had permitted him to visit the site with a friend, with whom he shared an interest in construction machinery. Eric was last seen speaking with Kirsty Chambers, a colleague of his friend's parent, who was operating equipment at the site. It is suspected that Eric might have witnessed a crime in the vicinity, leading to his sudden absence. Later, a member of the public found Eric at 2 Herod Hill Brae, Dundee, DD4 8FG, confused and dazed, but physically unharmed. His whereabouts during the missing period remain a concern, with further investigation ongoing to determine if foul play was involved.

narrative=Eric Haynes was last seen in the elevator of a building near his home at 22 Marine Parade Walk, Dundee. Before his disappearance, Eric had been spending time at a skate park with friends, including Leanne Carey. It was later revealed that Eric might have been a possible witness to a crime that occurred nearby, adding to concerns about his well-being. Further investigation suggested possible ties to a group living off-grid and potentially involved in cult activities. With the help of local authorities, Eric was eventually located at a construction site near Hyndford Street, appearing unharmed but slightly disoriented.

narrative=Eric Haynes was reported missing from his home at 22 Marine Parade Walk, Dundee. Before his disappearance, he had been spending time with friends and was last seen in a parking lot near Dundee Road, Arbroath. Eric's foster father and friends mentioned his interest in exploring the nearby waterways and his frequent trips to the locations around Auldbar Road, Forfar. Concerns quickly arose due to an ongoing search for a missing rental boat from a nearby harbor which Eric had shown interest in prior to vanishing. His foster father speculated on a possible boating incident, leading authorities to conduct extensive searches along the adjacent coastlines. Ultimately, Eric was traced by police alive and safe in the area of Forfar.
